item.title: Western Water and American Food Security Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 114-381.

item.title: Highway and Transportation Funding Act of 2015, Part II

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 157.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 245 - 183 (Roll no. 439). (text: CR H5188)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 245 - 183 (Roll no. 439).(text: CR H5188)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 245 - 182 (Roll no. 438). (consideration: CR H5197)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 362.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5188-5198)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 48.

The rule provide for consideration of the bills H.R. 2898 and H.R. 3038. The rule provides for 1 hour of general debate on both bills. The resolution makes in order further amendments printed in the report on H.R. 2898. For H.R. 3038, the resolution provides for consideration under a closed rule. The resolution provides for one motion to recommit with or without instructions on both bills.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-204, by Mr. Newhouse.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-204, by Mr. Newhouse.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2898) to provide drought relief in the State of California, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3038) to provide an extension of Federal-aid highway, highway safety, motor carrier safety, transit, and other programs funded out of the Highway Trust Fund.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2898) to provide drought relief in the State of California, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3038) to provide an extension of Federal-aid highway, highway safety, motor carrier safety, transit, and other programs funded out of the Highway Trust Fund, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
